snippet: Justice Eduardo Padro ruled that new evidence presented at a hearing this year would have changed the outcome of the first trial in the death of Brian Watkins, a tourist from Utah.
abstract: New York State Justice Eduardo Padro orders retrial for Johnny Hincapie of Queens, who was convicted of 1990 killing of Utah tourist Brian Watkins on subway platform in New York City; says new evidence would have led to different outcome in first trial as witnesses say they saw Watkins stabbed during mugging; 1990 case occurred during era of pervasive street violence in city.
lead_paragraph: Justice Eduardo Padro ruled that new evidence presented at a hearing this year would have changed the outcome of the first trial in the death of Brian Watkins, a tourist from Utah.

headline.print_headline: Judge Orders Retrial for Man Convicted in ’90 Subway Killing of Tourist
headline.main: Judge Orders Retrial for Johnny Hincapie, Convicted in ’90 Subway Killing
